justification: The article used the candy-bowl choice task to assess partition dependence, where participants chose candies from different bowls, and the influence of partitioning on selection was examined.
The candy-bowl choice task was used to measure diversification bias by observing if participants' candy selections were influenced by how candies were grouped across bowls.

measured_by: allocation of food tokens to zoo animals
justification: The task involving the allocation of food tokens to physically-partitioned zoo animals was used to measure partition dependence in children's resource allocation decisions.
